body.p:
Black Licks P. O.
Logan Co. Ky-
June 21 1861
Secty. Military Board
Dr Sir

Some three weeks since a Co. of Home Guards was formed at this place The County Judge superintend the election of Officers & adminstered the Oath of required by law to officers & men -- We then sent Mr. Jno, biers to Frankfort with the Bond of the Captain drawn up by the county Judge & certified by him to be good with 4 securities, to make application for arms -- He was informed that the Board had not acted yet & we must wait
I was elected Captain of the Company which numbers 70 men -- We have been drilling twice per week and are anxious to get arms -- We have a large slave population & are on the Rail Road track to Tenn- and feel insecure in life & property & feel that the state should supply us with arms --
I am ready to comply with any requirement your Board shall make

Russellville now has over 100 guns of the state then -- I think all the arms for this county should not be concentrate at that point I am Colonel of the Logan Militia and assure you the arms shall
be taken care of and used only in the spirit of the Law authorizing this distribution --

Hoping to hear from you at an early day I remain
very respectfully
C. H. Blakey
Capt. Home Guard

3
C. H. Blakey
Home Guards
Logan Co
Recd of 25 June 1861.
